data.name: World Rally Championship
data.description:
WORLD RALLY CHAMPIONSHIP SCHEDULE:</br>
Day1 (Friday): `Stage1: Asphalt = 38km, Stage2: Gravel = 79km, Stage3: Snow = 64km`.</br>
Day2 (Suturday): `Super Stage: TBA`.

RUNNING ORDER and WINNER:</br>
During the first day pilots are driving individually, stage times are being totalled.</br>
In Super Stage pilots are driving simultaneously, but going into course based on the handicap they have saved the previous day. Winner is decided whoever croses the finish line in Super Stage first.

CARS and their AVERAGE SPEEDS on Asphalt, Gravel and Snow, respectively:</br>
Toyota Yaris (without turbo installed) - `165kph, 139kph, 121kph`.</br>
Hyundai I20 (with turbo installed) - `194kph, 153kph, 130kph`.

YOUR TASK:
Return the winner (`"Toyota"` or `"Hyundai"`) and winner's split time over the other car as `"MM:SS"` (see test cases), based on Toyota's turbo's choice and the surface and length of Super Stage (given as an arguments). Turbo boost values range `from 1 to 25` and means equal percentage increase in speeds (rounded after increasing) in all three surfaces (`"Asphalt"`, `"Gravel"` and `"Snow"`). Length values range `from 1 to 100` (km).

You must assume Hyundai I20 will perform exactly on the average speeds noted above throughout the whole course and there will only be one surface in Super Stage. Finally, if there happens to be a tie (you'll be tested for it), return `"Toyota = Hyundai"`;

METRIC SYSTEM ONLY! Seconds must be rounded after each stage.
